This work made use of the CHE cluster, managed and funded by ICRA/CBPF/MCTI, with financial support from FINEP (grant 01.07.0515.00 from CT-INFRA &#8211; 01/2006) and FAPERJ (grants E-26/171.206/2006 and E-26/110.516/2012). This work made use of data taken under the ESO programme IDs 186.A-0798, 095.A-0525, 096.A-0105, 096.A-0650, 097.A-0909 and 098.A-0590.</p>\n<h2 class=\"sec\">\n<a name=\"ref\"></a>References</h2>\n    <div id=\"content\">\n        <ol class=\"references\">\n                    <li>\n                <a name=\"R1\"></a>Akaike, H. 1974, IEEE Trans. class=\"ligne\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/T6.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Table A.1.</span></a>\n<p>Median values and confidence levels of the cluster total mass distribution parameters from the MCMC analyses of the reference strong lensing models (see Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#T5\">5</a>).</p>\n</div></div></p>\n<p><a name=\"T7\"></a><div class=\"inset\"><div class=\"ligne\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/T7.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Table A.2.</span></a>\n<p>Information on the spectroscopically identified multiple images.</p>\n</div></div></p>\n<p><a name=\"F9\"></a><div class=\"inset\"><table><tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F9.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig9_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F9.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. A.1.</span></a>\n<p>MUSE spectra of multiply lensed background sources. Vertical black lines indicate the positions of spectral features used to estimate the redshifts. The grey area shows the rescaled variance obtained from the data reduction pipeline; the flux is given in units of 10<sup>&#8722;20</sup> erg s<sup>&#8722;1</sup> cm<sup>&#8722;2</sup> &#197;<sup>&#8722;1</sup>. The image boxes are extracted from the CLASH colour images and have 2&#8243; side. The white circles show the HST counterparts and, for the cases with no apparent photometric counterparts, they are centred at the position of the MUSE peak emission. We remark that multiple image MACS J0329-9c has an independent redshift measurement from Vanzella et al. (in prep.).</p>\n</td>\n</tr></table></div></p>\n<p><a name=\"F10\"></a><div class=\"inset\"><table><tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F10.html\" href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/T7.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Table A.2.</span></a>\n<p>Information on the spectroscopically identified multiple images.</p>\n<div class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#T7\">In the text</a></div>\n</div></div>\n<h2 class=\"sec\">\n<a name=\"figs\"></a>All Figures</h2>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F1.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig1_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F1.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 1.</span></a>\n<p>Colour composite images of the eight clusters in our sample created from the combination of the HST/ACS and WFC3 imaging. Circles show the multiple image positions used as model constraints in our strong lens modelling. We identify in white the families with spectroscopic redshift measurements and in green those for which the redshift value is a free parameter in our models (considered only in our silver sample, see Sect. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#S6\">3</a> for more details). Blue boxes indicate the BCG positions.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F1\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F2.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig2_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F2.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 2.</span></a>\n<p>Cluster member selection. White and magenta circles show the position of the cluster members with MUSE spectroscopic confirmation and selected from photometry, respectively. Red boxes show the cluster members spectroscopically confirmed by CLASH-VLT and thus included in the final member catalogue, but not selected by our criteria. The green regions show the area covered by the MUSE observations.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F2\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F3.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig3_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F3.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 3.</span></a>\n<p>Same as in Fig. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F2\">2</a> but for the silver sample of galaxy clusters. Red regions indicate MUSE exposures with less than one hour on target. We note that MACS J0429 is not a CLASH-VLT cluster.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F3\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F4.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig4_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F4.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 4.</span></a>\n<p>Colour-magnitude diagrams showing the red-sequence for all clusters analysed in this work. Only for RX J2129 we use the filters F435W and F814W because of its low redshift, for all remaining clusters we use the F814W and F160W bands. Orange circles indicate the spectroscopically confirmed members. The grey region shows our colour cut and the photometric redshift range used to select photometric members is quoted in the legend (see Sect. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#S8\">3.2</a> for more details). Both criteria are used to select the photometric members that are indicated by magenta circles. A summary of the membership selection is shown in Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#T3\">3</a>.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F4\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F5.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig5_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F5.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 5.</span></a>\n<p><i>Top panel</i>: ESO/FORS2 stacked spectrum of the multiple images belonging to family 9 in MACS J0329 in arbitrary units, totaling 33 h of exposure time on target. The original data and continuum are shown in blue and orange, respectively. The vertical red line indicates the Lyman-break position around &#8776;8720 &#197; and the dashed horizontal line shows the zero level. <i>Middle and bottom panels</i>: two-dimensional signal-to-noise ratio of the data and the sky emission.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F5\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F6.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig6_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F6.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 6.</span></a>\n<p><i>Top row</i>: cumulative projected total mass profile out to <i>R</i>&#8196;=&#8196;470 kpc from our reference lensing models using the PIEMD (blue) and gNFW (magenta) profiles for the main smooth mass component. Red and green regions show the models from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R97\">Zitrin et al. (2015)</a> with the two parametrizations NFW and LTM, respectively. <i>Bottom row</i>: same for the total surface mass density profile. The areas correspond to the 95% confidence level regions from 1000 random realizations of our models and 100 for the NFW and LTM models. Vertical lines indicate the distances from the BCG of the multiple images used to constraint the cluster total mass model in this work (black) and in <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R97\">Zitrin et al. (2015)</a> (red, mainly with no spectroscopic measurements). The position of the centre used to compute the profiles in each realization is given by the centre of mass estimated within a circle of 10&#8243; radius from the BCG. We remark that the external smooth components of MACS J1931 and MACS J2129 do not affect the total mass distributions over the radial distances considered here.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F6\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F7.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig7_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F7.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 7.</span></a>\n<p>Same as in Fig. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F6\">6</a>, but for the silver sample, i.e. the four clusters with lower number of strong lensing constraints.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F7\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F8.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig8_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F8.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 8.</span></a>\n<p>Projected total mass (cumulative, <i>left panel</i>) and mass density (<i>right panel</i>) profiles rescaled by the quantities <i>M</i><sub>200c</sub> and <i>R</i><sub>200c</sub> from independent weak lensing measurements. In addition to the four galaxy clusters with the best strong lensing models presented in this work (i.e., the gold sample), we also show the profiles of MACS J1206, Abell 1063 and MACS J0416, the last one is known to be a prominent merging cluster. The vertical lines indicate the distances from the cluster centers of the multiple images belonging to the spectroscopically confirmed families.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F8\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F9.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig9_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F9.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. A.1.</span></a>\n<p>MUSE spectra of multiply lensed background sources. Vertical black lines indicate the positions of spectral features used to estimate the redshifts. The grey area shows the rescaled variance obtained from the data reduction pipeline; the flux is given in units of 10<sup>&#8722;20</sup> erg s<sup>&#8722;1</sup> cm<sup>&#8722;2</sup> &#197;<sup>&#8722;1</sup>. The image boxes are extracted from the CLASH colour images and have 2&#8243; side. The white circles show the HST counterparts and, for the cases with no apparent photometric counterparts, they are centred at the position of the MUSE peak emission. We remark that multiple image MACS J0329-9c has an independent redshift measurement from Vanzella et al. (in prep.).</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F9\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F10.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig10_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F10.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. A.1.</span></a>\n<p>continued.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F10\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F11.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig11_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F11.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. A.1.</span></a>\n<p>continued.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F11\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F12.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig12_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F12.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. A.1.</span></a>\n<p>continued.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F12\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F13.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-fig13_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/F13.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. A.1.</span></a>\n<p>continued.</p>\n</td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F13\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n</div>\n\n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button Zitrin\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Physics Department, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, PO Box 653, Be\u2019er-Sheva 84105, Israel\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing models of eight CLASH clusters from extensive spectroscopy: Accurate total mass reconstructions in the cores\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2019/11/25\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2019/12/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"632\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A36\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2019A%26A...632A..36C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2019/12/aa35454-19.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We carried out a detailed strong lensing analysis of a sub-sample of eight galaxy clusters of the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; (CLASH) in the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;cluster&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.23\u2005\u2212\u20050.59] using extensive spectroscopic information, primarily from the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) archival data and complemented with CLASH-VLT redshift measurements. The observed positions of the multiple images of strongly lensed background sources were used to constrain parametric models describing the cluster total mass distributions. Different models were tested in each cluster depending on the complexity of its mass distribution and on the number of detected multiple images. Four clusters show more than five spectroscopically confirmed multiple image families. In this sample, we did not make use of families that are only photometrically identified in order to reduce model degeneracies between the values of the total mass of a cluster source redshifts, in addition to systematics due to the potential misidentifications of multiple images. For the remaining four clusters, we used additional families without any spectroscopic confirmation to increase the number of strong lensing constraints up to the number of free parameters in our parametric models. We present spectroscopic confirmation of 27 multiply lensed sources, with no previous spectroscopic measurements, spanning over the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;src&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.7\u2005\u2212\u20056.1]. Moreover, we confirm an average of 48 galaxy members in the core of each cluster thanks to the high efficiency and large field of view of MUSE. We used this information to derive precise strong lensing models, projected total mass distributions, and magnification maps. We show that, despite having different properties (i.e. number of mass components, total mass, redshift, etc.), the projected total mass and mass density profiles of all clusters have very similar shapes when rescaled by independent measurements of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;. Specifically, we measured the mean value of the projected total mass of our cluster sample within 10 (20)% of &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; to be 0.13 (0.32) of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;, with a remarkably small scatter of 5 (6)%. Furthermore, the large number of high-&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; sources and the precise magnification maps derived in this work for four clusters add up to the sample of high-quality gravitational telescopes to be used to study the faint and distant Universe.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=European Research Council; {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-eq356.gif\" width=\"28\" height=\"21\" /></span></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b> The values of the velocity dispersion parameters (<i>&#963;</i><sub>v</sub>) are rescaled by the factor <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-eq357.gif\" width=\"38\" height=\"21\" /></span> as described in the <tt>lenstool</tt> manual (see <a href=\"http://projets.lam.fr/projects/lenstool/wiki/PIEMD\" target=\"_blank\">http://projets.lam.fr/projects/lenstool/wiki/PIEMD</a>). The reference luminosities for the galaxy member parameters (<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-eq358.gif\" width=\"31\" height=\"21\" /></span> and <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-eq359.gif\" width=\"28\" height=\"23\" /></span>, see Eq. (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#FD1\">1</a>)) correspond to the rest-frame magnitude of <i>M</i><sub>F160W</sub>&#8196;=&#8196;&#8722;23 for each cluster.</p>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" Demarco\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda, Facultad de Ciencias F\u00edsicas y Matem\u00e1ticas, Universidad de Concepci\u00f3n, Concepci\u00f3n, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. M. Koekemoer\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Space Telescope Science Institute, 3700 San Martin Dr., Baltimore, MD 21218, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"M. Lombardi\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Dipartimento di Fisica, Universit\u00e0 degli Studi di Milano, Via Celoria 16, 20133 Milano, Italy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"C. Maier\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"M. Verdugo\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. Zitrin\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Physics Department, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, PO Box 653, Be\u2019er-Sheva 84105, Israel\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing models of eight CLASH clusters from extensive spectroscopy: Accurate total mass reconstructions in the cores\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2019/11/25\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2019/12/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"632\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A36\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2019A%26A...632A..36C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2019/12/aa35454-19.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We carried out a detailed strong lensing analysis of a sub-sample of eight galaxy clusters of the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; (CLASH) in the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;cluster&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.23\u2005\u2212\u20050.59] using extensive spectroscopic information, primarily from the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) archival data and complemented with CLASH-VLT redshift measurements. The observed positions of the multiple images of strongly lensed background sources were used to constrain parametric models describing the cluster total mass distributions. Different models were tested in each cluster depending on the complexity of its mass distribution and on the number of detected multiple images. Four clusters show more than five spectroscopically confirmed multiple image families. In this sample, we did not make use of families that are only photometrically identified in order to reduce model degeneracies between the values of the total mass of a cluster source redshifts, in addition to systematics due to the potential misidentifications of multiple images. For the remaining four clusters, we used additional families without any spectroscopic confirmation to increase the number of strong lensing constraints up to the number of free parameters in our parametric models. We present spectroscopic confirmation of 27 multiply lensed sources, with no previous spectroscopic measurements, spanning over the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;src&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.7\u2005\u2212\u20056.1]. Moreover, we confirm an average of 48 galaxy members in the core of each cluster thanks to the high efficiency and large field of view of MUSE. We used this information to derive precise strong lensing models, projected total mass distributions, and magnification maps. We show that, despite having different properties (i.e. number of mass components, total mass, redshift, etc.), the projected total mass and mass density profiles of all clusters have very similar shapes when rescaled by independent measurements of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;. Specifically, we measured the mean value of the projected total mass of our cluster sample within 10 (20)% of &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; to be 0.13 (0.32) of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;, with a remarkably small scatter of 5 (6)%. Furthermore, the large number of high-&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; sources and the precise magnification maps derived in this work for four clusters add up to the sample of high-quality gravitational telescopes to be used to study the faint and distant Universe.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=European Research Council; Meneghetti;citation_publication_date=2019;citation_journal_title=MNRAS;citation_volume=483;citation_firstpage=3618;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=M. Verdugo;citation_author=M. Lerchster;citation_author=H. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div <div>\r\n    \n<div class=\"special_article green\">Free Access</div>\n    \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n<div id=\"article\">\r\n    <?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"ASCII\" standalone=\"yes\"?>\n<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN\" \"\">\n\n    <div id=\"annex\">\n      <h2 class=\"sec\">Table 2. </h2>\n      <p>Full redshift catalogue.</p>\n      <div class=\"tab\">\n        <table width=\"100%\" class=\"fm\" frame=\"hsides\" rules=\"groups\">\n<thead>\n<tr>\n<th align=\"center\">ID</th>\n<th align=\"center\">RA</th>\n<th align=\"center\">Dec</th>\n<th align=\"center\"><i>z</i><sub>MUSE</sub></th>\n<th align=\"center\">QF</th>\n<th align=\"center\">Mult.</th>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<th align=\"center\">(A)</th>\n<th align=\"center\">(B)</th>\n<th align=\"center\">(C)</th>\n<th align=\"center\">(D)</th>\n<th align=\"center\">(E)</th>\n<th align=\"center\">(F)</th>\n</tr>\n</thead>\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"center\">R2129-J212939.77+000458.74</td>\n<td align=\"center\">322.4157062</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.0829825</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.1288</td>\n<td align=\"center\">3</td>\n<td align=\"center\">1</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"center\">R2129-J212940.68+000509.74</td>\n<td align=\"center\">322.4195150</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.0860391</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.1344</td>\n<td align=\"center\">3</td>\n<td align=\"center\">1</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"center\">R2129-J212938.71+000510.68</td>\n<td align=\"center\">322.4112998</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.0863003</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.1348</td>\n<td align=\"center\">3</td>\n<td align=\"center\">1</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"center\">R2129-J212937.16+000524.20</td>\n<td align=\"center\">322.4048393</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.0900552</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.1374</td>\n<td align=\"center\">3</td>\n<td align=\"center\">1</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"center\">R2129-J212940.84+000555.17</td>\n<td align=\"center\">322.4201773</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.0986576</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.1378</td>\n<td align=\"center\">3</td>\n<td align=\"center\">1</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8942;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8942;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8942;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8942;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8942;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8942;</td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b> Five entries of the full redshift catalogue that is available at the CDS. The columns are: (A) the ID build from the cluster name and object RA and Dec; (B) and (C) are the observed right ascension and declination in degrees; (D) and (E) are the spectroscopic redshift and its quality flag; (F) is the number of entries of the same object in this catalogue used to indicate multiply lensed sources.</p>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" Zitrin\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Physics Department, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, PO Box 653, Be\u2019er-Sheva 84105, Israel\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing models of eight CLASH clusters from extensive spectroscopy: Accurate total mass reconstructions in the cores\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2019/11/25\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2019/12/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"632\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A36\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2019A%26A...632A..36C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2019/12/aa35454-19.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We carried out a detailed strong lensing analysis of a sub-sample of eight galaxy clusters of the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; (CLASH) in the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;cluster&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.23\u2005\u2212\u20050.59] using extensive spectroscopic information, primarily from the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) archival data and complemented with CLASH-VLT redshift measurements. The observed positions of the multiple images of strongly lensed background sources were used to constrain parametric models describing the cluster total mass distributions. Different models were tested in each cluster depending on the complexity of its mass distribution and on the number of detected multiple images. Four clusters show more than five spectroscopically confirmed multiple image families. In this sample, we did not make use of families that are only photometrically identified in order to reduce model degeneracies between the values of the total mass of a cluster source redshifts, in addition to systematics due to the potential misidentifications of multiple images. For the remaining four clusters, we used additional families without any spectroscopic confirmation to increase the number of strong lensing constraints up to the number of free parameters in our parametric models. We present spectroscopic confirmation of 27 multiply lensed sources, with no previous spectroscopic measurements, spanning over the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;src&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.7\u2005\u2212\u20056.1]. Moreover, we confirm an average of 48 galaxy members in the core of each cluster thanks to the high efficiency and large field of view of MUSE. We used this information to derive precise strong lensing models, projected total mass distributions, and magnification maps. We show that, despite having different properties (i.e. number of mass components, total mass, redshift, etc.), the projected total mass and mass density profiles of all clusters have very similar shapes when rescaled by independent measurements of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;. Specifically, we measured the mean value of the projected total mass of our cluster sample within 10 (20)% of &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; to be 0.13 (0.32) of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;, with a remarkably small scatter of 5 (6)%. Furthermore, the large number of high-&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; sources and the precise magnification maps derived in this work for four clusters add up to the sample of high-quality gravitational telescopes to be used to study the faint and distant Universe.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=European Research Council; {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div for each cluster is shown in Figs. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F2\">2</a> and <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#F3\">3</a>.</p>\n<div><a name=\"TFN1\" id=\"TFN1\"></a><sup>(a)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Number of exposures in each pointing used to create the final data-cube.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN2\" id=\"TFN2\"></a><sup>(b)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Median value of the seeing, measured from the DIMM station, and its standard deviation.</p></div>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico 'none') {\n              toggle_switch.html('More');\n            } else {\n              toggle_switch.html('Less');\n            }\n          });\n        });\n      });\n    });\n  </script>\n Verdugo\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. Zitrin\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Physics Department, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, PO Box 653, Be\u2019er-Sheva 84105, Israel\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing models of eight CLASH clusters from extensive spectroscopy: Accurate total mass reconstructions in the cores\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2019/11/25\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2019/12/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"632\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A36\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2019A%26A...632A..36C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2019/12/aa35454-19.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We carried out a detailed strong lensing analysis of a sub-sample of eight galaxy clusters of the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; (CLASH) in the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;cluster&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.23\u2005\u2212\u20050.59] using extensive spectroscopic information, primarily from the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) archival data and complemented with CLASH-VLT redshift measurements. The observed positions of the multiple images of strongly lensed background sources were used to constrain parametric models describing the cluster total mass distributions. Different models were tested in each cluster depending on the complexity of its mass distribution and on the number of detected multiple images. Four clusters show more than five spectroscopically confirmed multiple image families. In this sample, we did not make use of families that are only photometrically identified in order to reduce model degeneracies between the values of the total mass of a cluster source redshifts, in addition to systematics due to the potential misidentifications of multiple images. For the remaining four clusters, we used additional families without any spectroscopic confirmation to increase the number of strong lensing constraints up to the number of free parameters in our parametric models. We present spectroscopic confirmation of 27 multiply lensed sources, with no previous spectroscopic measurements, spanning over the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;src&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.7\u2005\u2212\u20056.1]. Moreover, we confirm an average of 48 galaxy members in the core of each cluster thanks to the high efficiency and large field of view of MUSE. We used this information to derive precise strong lensing models, projected total mass distributions, and magnification maps. We show that, despite having different properties (i.e. number of mass components, total mass, redshift, etc.), the projected total mass and mass density profiles of all clusters have very similar shapes when rescaled by independent measurements of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;. Specifically, we measured the mean value of the projected total mass of our cluster sample within 10 (20)% of &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; to be 0.13 (0.32) of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;, with a remarkably small scatter of 5 (6)%. Furthermore, the large number of high-&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; sources and the precise magnification maps derived in this work for four clusters add up to the sample of high-quality gravitational telescopes to be used to study the faint and distant Universe.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=European Research Council; {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b></p>\n<div><a name=\"TFN12\" id=\"TFN12\"></a><sup>(a)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Spectroscopic redshifts from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R10\">Belli et al. (2013)</a>.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN13\" id=\"TFN13\"></a><sup>(b)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Spectroscopic redshifts from CLASH-VLT (Rosati et al., in prep.).</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN14\" id=\"TFN14\"></a><sup>(c)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Spectroscopic redshift from Vanzella et al. (in prep.).</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN15\" id=\"TFN15\"></a><sup>(d)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Spectroscopic confirmation from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R39\">Huang et al. (2016)</a>.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN16\" id=\"TFN16\"></a><sup>(e)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Photometric redshift limits from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R59\">Molino et al. (2017)</a>.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN17\" id=\"TFN17\"></a><sup>(f)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Independent spectroscopic confirmations from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R69\">Ravindranath &amp; Ho (2002)</a>, <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R17\">Brada&#269; et al. (2008)</a>, <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R36\">Halkola et al. (2008)</a>.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN18\" id=\"TFN18\"></a><sup>(g)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Spectroscopic redshift from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R27\">Cohen &amp; Kneib (2002)</a>.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN19\" id=\"TFN19\"></a><sup>(h)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Spectroscopic redshift obtained from the public GLASS catalogues <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R80\">Treu et al. (2015)</a>.</p></div>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. Demarco\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda, Facultad de Ciencias F\u00edsicas y Matem\u00e1ticas, Universidad de Concepci\u00f3n, Concepci\u00f3n, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. M. Lombardi\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Dipartimento di Fisica, Universit\u00e0 degli Studi di Milano, Via Celoria 16, 20133 Milano, Italy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"C. Maier\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"M. Verdugo\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. Zitrin\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Physics Department, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, PO Box 653, Be\u2019er-Sheva 84105, Israel\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing models of eight CLASH clusters from extensive spectroscopy: Accurate total mass reconstructions in the cores\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2019/11/25\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2019/12/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"632\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A36\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2019A%26A...632A..36C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2019/12/aa35454-19.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We carried out a detailed strong lensing analysis of a sub-sample of eight galaxy clusters of the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; (CLASH) in the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;cluster&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.23\u2005\u2212\u20050.59] using extensive spectroscopic information, primarily from the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) archival data and complemented with CLASH-VLT redshift measurements. The observed positions of the multiple images of strongly lensed background sources were used to constrain parametric models describing the cluster total mass distributions. Different models were tested in each cluster depending on the complexity of its mass distribution and on the number of detected multiple images. Four clusters show more than five spectroscopically confirmed multiple image families. In this sample, we did not make use of families that are only photometrically identified in order to reduce model degeneracies between the values of the total mass of a cluster source redshifts, in addition to systematics due to the potential misidentifications of multiple images. For the remaining four clusters, we used additional families without any spectroscopic confirmation to increase the number of strong lensing constraints up to the number of free parameters in our parametric models. We present spectroscopic confirmation of 27 multiply lensed sources, with no previous spectroscopic measurements, spanning over the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;src&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.7\u2005\u2212\u20056.1]. Moreover, we confirm an average of 48 galaxy members in the core of each cluster thanks to the high efficiency and large field of view of MUSE. We used this information to derive precise strong lensing models, projected total mass distributions, and magnification maps. We show that, despite having different properties (i.e. number of mass components, total mass, redshift, etc.), the projected total mass and mass density profiles of all clusters have very similar shapes when rescaled by independent measurements of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;. Specifically, we measured the mean value of the projected total mass of our cluster sample within 10 (20)% of &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; to be 0.13 (0.32) of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;, with a remarkably small scatter of 5 (6)%. Furthermore, the large number of high-&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; sources and the precise magnification maps derived in this work for four clusters add up to the sample of high-quality gravitational telescopes to be used to study the faint and distant Universe.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=European Research Council; Salvaterra;citation_publication_date=2014;citation_journal_title=MNRAS;citation_volume=443;citation_firstpage=L20;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=H. Broadhurst;citation_publication_date=2014;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=793;citation_firstpage=L12;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=A. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n <div>\r\n    \n<div class=\"special_article green\">Free Access</div>\n    \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n<div id=\"article\">\r\n    <?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"ASCII\" standalone=\"yes\"?>\n<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC \"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN\" \"\">\n\n    <div id=\"annex\">\n      <h2 class=\"sec\">Table 5. </h2>\n      <p>Models summary.</p>\n      <div class=\"tab\">\n        <table width=\"100%\" class=\"fm\" frame=\"hsides\" rules=\"groups\">\n<thead>\n<tr>\n<th align=\"left\">Model ID</th>\n<th align=\"center\">N. par.</th>\n<th align=\"center\">d.o.f.</th>\n<th align=\"center\">&#916;<sub>rms</sub> [&#8243;]</th>\n<th align=\"center\"><span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-eq42.gif\" width=\"29\" height=\"20\" /></span></th>\n<th align=\"center\">BIC</th>\n<th align=\"center\">AIC</th>\n<th align=\"center\">Description</th>\n</tr>\n</thead>\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"left\"><b>RXJ 2129-P1</b></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><b>8</b></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><b>22</b></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><b>0.20</b></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><b>3.39</b></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><b>34.7</b></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><b>27.6</b></td>\n<td align=\"center\">One smooth elliptical PIEMD component</td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"left\"><i>RXJ 2129-gNFW1</i></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><i>9</i></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><i>21</i></td>\n<td align=\"center\"><i>0.22</i></td>\n<td (2017a)</a></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b> For each model, we present the number of free parameters (N. par.), the degree of freedom (d.o.f.), the root-mean-square difference between the model predicted and observed multiple image positions (&#916;<sub>rms</sub>), the minimum <i>&#967;</i><sup>2</sup> (see Eq. (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#FD2\">2</a>)), the Bayesian and Akaike information criteria (BIC and AIC, respectively), and a short description of the model parametrization. Rows in boldface are our reference models, since they have the lowest BIC and AIC values. Model IDs in italics have the main smooth component parametrised by a gNFW mass profile.</p>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. Verdugo\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. Zitrin\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Physics Department, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, PO Box 653, Be\u2019er-Sheva 84105, Israel\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing models of eight CLASH clusters from extensive spectroscopy: Accurate total mass reconstructions in the cores\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2019/11/25\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2019/12/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"632\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A36\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2019A%26A...632A..36C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2019/12/aa35454-19.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We carried out a detailed strong lensing analysis of a sub-sample of eight galaxy clusters of the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; (CLASH) in the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;cluster&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.23\u2005\u2212\u20050.59] using extensive spectroscopic information, primarily from the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) archival data and complemented with CLASH-VLT redshift measurements. The observed positions of the multiple images of strongly lensed background sources were used to constrain parametric models describing the cluster total mass distributions. Different models were tested in each cluster depending on the complexity of its mass distribution and on the number of detected multiple images. Four clusters show more than five spectroscopically confirmed multiple image families. In this sample, we did not make use of families that are only photometrically identified in order to reduce model degeneracies between the values of the total mass of a cluster source redshifts, in addition to systematics due to the potential misidentifications of multiple images. For the remaining four clusters, we used additional families without any spectroscopic confirmation to increase the number of strong lensing constraints up to the number of free parameters in our parametric models. We present spectroscopic confirmation of 27 multiply lensed sources, with no previous spectroscopic measurements, spanning over the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;src&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.7\u2005\u2212\u20056.1]. Moreover, we confirm an average of 48 galaxy members in the core of each cluster thanks to the high efficiency and large field of view of MUSE. We used this information to derive precise strong lensing models, projected total mass distributions, and magnification maps. We show that, despite having different properties (i.e. number of mass components, total mass, redshift, etc.), the projected total mass and mass density profiles of all clusters have very similar shapes when rescaled by independent measurements of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;. Specifically, we measured the mean value of the projected total mass of our cluster sample within 10 (20)% of &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; to be 0.13 (0.32) of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;, with a remarkably small scatter of 5 (6)%. Furthermore, the large number of high-&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; sources and the precise magnification maps derived in this work for four clusters add up to the sample of high-quality gravitational telescopes to be used to study the faint and distant Universe.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=European Research Council; {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div align=\"center\">12</td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b></p>\n<div><a name=\"TFN3\" id=\"TFN3\"></a><sup>(a)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Total number of selected cluster members, i.e. spectroscopically confirmed and photometrically selected.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN4\" id=\"TFN4\"></a><sup>(b)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Number of members with spectroscopic confirmation from MUSE.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN5\" id=\"TFN5\"></a><sup>(c)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Number of interlopers and missing members are obtained from CLASH-VLT redshift measurements outside the MUSE field of view. Spectroscopic interlopers (missing) members are removed (included) in the final version of the membership selection.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN6\" id=\"TFN6\"></a><sup>(d)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Clusters with shallow MUSE data to data (&lt; 1 h) or with a small number of spectroscopically confirmed multiple images.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN7\" id=\"TFN7\"></a><sup>(e)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Not available since MACS J0429 was not included in CLASH-VLT.</p></div>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico Lombardi\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Dipartimento di Fisica, Universit\u00e0 degli Studi di Milano, Via Celoria 16, 20133 Milano, Italy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"C. Maier\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"M. Verdugo\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, Tuerkenschanzstrasse 17, 1180 Vienna, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. Zitrin\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Physics Department, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, PO Box 653, Be\u2019er-Sheva 84105, Israel\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing models of eight CLASH clusters from extensive spectroscopy: Accurate total mass reconstructions in the cores\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2019/11/25\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2019/12/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"632\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A36\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2019A%26A...632A..36C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2019/12/aa35454-19.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"We carried out a detailed strong lensing analysis of a sub-sample of eight galaxy clusters of the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; (CLASH) in the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;cluster&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.23\u2005\u2212\u20050.59] using extensive spectroscopic information, primarily from the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) archival data and complemented with CLASH-VLT redshift measurements. The observed positions of the multiple images of strongly lensed background sources were used to constrain parametric models describing the cluster total mass distributions. Different models were tested in each cluster depending on the complexity of its mass distribution and on the number of detected multiple images. Four clusters show more than five spectroscopically confirmed multiple image families. In this sample, we did not make use of families that are only photometrically identified in order to reduce model degeneracies between the values of the total mass of a cluster source redshifts, in addition to systematics due to the potential misidentifications of multiple images. For the remaining four clusters, we used additional families without any spectroscopic confirmation to increase the number of strong lensing constraints up to the number of free parameters in our parametric models. We present spectroscopic confirmation of 27 multiply lensed sources, with no previous spectroscopic measurements, spanning over the redshift range of &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;src&lt;sub/&gt;\u2004=\u2004[0.7\u2005\u2212\u20056.1]. Moreover, we confirm an average of 48 galaxy members in the core of each cluster thanks to the high efficiency and large field of view of MUSE. We used this information to derive precise strong lensing models, projected total mass distributions, and magnification maps. We show that, despite having different properties (i.e. number of mass components, total mass, redshift, etc.), the projected total mass and mass density profiles of all clusters have very similar shapes when rescaled by independent measurements of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;. Specifically, we measured the mean value of the projected total mass of our cluster sample within 10 (20)% of &lt;i&gt;R&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt; to be 0.13 (0.32) of &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;200c&lt;sub/&gt;, with a remarkably small scatter of 5 (6)%. Furthermore, the large number of high-&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; sources and the precise magnification maps derived in this work for four clusters add up to the sample of high-quality gravitational telescopes to be used to study the faint and distant Universe.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=European Research Council; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100000781; citation_grant_number=681627-BUILDUP;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Villum Fonden; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100008398; citation_grant_number=10123;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Istituto Nazionale di Astrofisica; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100005184; citation_grant_number=1.05.01.88.04;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Ministry of Science and Technology, Taiwan; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004663; citation_grant_number=106-2628-M-001-003-MY3;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Academia Sinica; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100001869; citation_grant_number=AS-IA-107-M01;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Centro de Astrof\u00edsica y Tecnolog\u00edas Afines; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004974; citation_grant_number=AFB-170002;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Financiadora de Estudos e Projetos; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004809; {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div align=\"center\">8</td>\n<td align=\"center\">[2.19]</td>\n<td align=\"center\">1.43&#8197;&#177;&#8197;0.07</td>\n<td align=\"center\">4.6&#8197;&#177;&#8197;0.3 <sup><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/T4.html#TFN11\">(d)</a></sup></td>\n<td align=\"center\">1.33&#8197;&#177;&#8197;0.03 <sup><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/T4.html#TFN11\">(d)</a></sup></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b></p>\n<div><a name=\"TFN8\" id=\"TFN8\"></a><sup>(a)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Total mass value projected within a circle with a radius of 200 kpc computed using our strong lensing reference models, as described in Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#T5\">5</a>.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN9\" id=\"TFN9\"></a><sup>(b)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Clusters with shallow MUSE data (&lt; 1 h) or with a small number of spectroscopically confirmed multiple images.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN10\" id=\"TFN10\"></a><sup>(c)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\"><span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-eq38.gif\" width=\"50\" height=\"20\" /></span> and <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19-eq39.gif\" width=\"47\" height=\"20\" /></span> are weak lensing measurements taken from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R84\">Umetsu et al. (2018)</a>.</p></div>\n<div><a name=\"TFN11\" id=\"TFN11\"></a><sup>(d)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Weak lensing values for MACS J1311 are taken from <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2019/12/aa35454-19/aa35454-19.html#R58\">Merten et al. (2015)</a>, the most recent measurements for this cluster.</p></div>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201935454\" data-edps_ref=\"aa35454-19\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico
